title: What to Expect From Tesla, Twitter And Amazon’s Q3 Results
text:
Ahead of Q3 earnings, broker consensus shows a hold recommendation on Twitter and Tesla and a strong buy recommendation on Amazon (NASDAQ: ).

Twitter

When are the Tesla, Twitter and Amazon earnings dates?

Tesla Q3 2019 preview: ‘The Street’ view, broker ratings and client sentiment

Tesla (NASDAQ: ), the Nasdaq-listed and world-leading electric car specialist, is expected to report its third-quarter (Q3) earnings for 2019 on Wednesday, 23 October.Twitter (NYSE: ), the Nasdaq-listed social networking service, is expected to report its Q3 earnings for 2019 on Thursday, 24 October.Amazon (NASDAQ: ), the Nasdaq-listed eCommerce giant, is expected to report its Q3 earnings for 2019 on Thursday, 24 October.

A consensus of estimates from Bloomberg surveyed analysts arrived at the following expectations for the Q3 2019 Tesla results:

Revenue: $6.358 billion (-6.8% year-on-year [YoY])

Net income on an adjusted basis: -$45.548 million

Operating profit: $43.129 million

Earnings per share (EPS) on an adjusted basis: -$0.246

EPS - generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP): -$1.456

Broker ratings

Broker ratings

Client sentiment

Client sentiment

A Thomson Reuters poll of 33 analysts maintains a long-term average rating of hold for Tesla (as of 16 October 2019), with 7 of these analysts recommending a strong buy, 4 recommending a buy, 10 holds, 8 sells and 4 with a strong sell recommendation on the stock.

IG clients (50% of them) with open positions on Tesla Inc (as of 16 October 2019) expect the share price to rise in the near term.

Tesla technical view

Tesla technical view

The share price of Tesla has broken out of a triangle consolidation. The breakout has, however, moved the share into overbought territory. Traders of the triangle breakout might hope for a pullback towards the 240 support level for long entry, targeting a move back towards resistance at 268. Should the share price instead move to close below the 220 support level, the bullish indications would be deemed to have failed.

description: Shares Analysis by Shaun Murison covering: Amazon.com Inc, Tesla Inc, Twitter Inc. Read Shaun Murison's latest article on Investing.com South Africa.
